posts.title: Momentary Announces Performance Lineup Through 2022
posts.content:
Embracing the energy of a changing season, the Momentary announced an exciting lineup of unique performance experiences through the end of the year.

  • Coming to you: A diverse lineup of artists will deliver genre-bending performances, from dynamic collaborations between Northwest Arkansas artists to international touring acrobatic theatre, as the contemporary art space continues to host artists engaging in thoughtful experimentation and play.
  • To choose from: Throughout the rest of 2022, guests can experience one-night collaborative performances, weekend experiences, week-long performances, and an entire art festival. From an all-woman acrobatic theatre to a contemporary chamber opera vocalist, composer, and more, there is much to see. So take your pick! Tickets are $0-$20, depending on the event. 

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Hoorah for the weekend! We've compiled some events you might enjoy:

  • Saying goodbye: The second to last weekend of the 112 Drive-In is this weekend, showing Wizard of Oz and Twister. 
  • In one place: Support Black-Owned businesses at an expo tomorrow at Theatre Squared in Fayetteville. 
  • Tunes: There’s live music all over NWA this weekend. Just take your pick. 
  • Squares: Saturdays are great days for Farmers Market hopping! 
  • Local government: Meet the Justice of the Peace candidates in Bentonville this evening from 6-8p!
  • Partay: Put on your scrunchies and wild windbreakers for a 90’s party at The Shire Gastropub in Rogers tomorrow from 9p-1a. 
  • Listen and relax: The Momentary is hosting its Courtyard Sessions on Sunday from 4-8p. 
  • Sip and stretch: Attend a 45 min yoga, movement, and meditation experience in the New Province Brewing Company taproom on Sunday. 

Have a great weekend, stay safe, and we'll see you Monday!

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • Lifewater International is looking for an IT Specialist
  • TheatreSquared has a position open for a Human Resources Director

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

posts.title: Allegiant Carries Record Passengers Two Consecutive Months
posts.content:
Allegiant Air, a low-fare airline at Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA), has put more passengers on planes than it ever has at XNA for the second consecutive month.

  • By the seat: 14,947 passengers flew Allegiant from XNA in June, marking the airline’s best month until July. 16,020 people boarded Allegiant flights in July out of the airport’s total 79,699 passengers. 
  • Load factors: Last month, Allegiant had the airport’s highest load factor, filling 89% of its seats. American Airlines (XNA’s largest airline) served 83% of its seats but accounted for 46% of all travelers. United Airlines had a load factor of 88%, Delta’s was a solid 87%, Breeze Airways filled 77% of its seats, and Frontier Airlines brought up the tail number with 73%. 

Read the Fare Flight story HERE.

posts.title: Only In Arkansas Features NWA Co-working Spaces
posts.content:
Working from home has made its way into the “new normal” of our lives. For many, the “home” they work from is a co-working space, which has become a great alternative to an office. 

  • WFH away from home: Only in Arkansas recently published a detailed list of Arkansas co-working spaces highlighting Northwest Arkansas’s fair share of official locations. Though coffee shops and the public library are not bad places to call home for the workday, an official work environment does prove productive.
  • To name a few: In Fayetteville, there is CenterSpace and Likewise. Rogers has Punktuary, loloft, and The Cofounder. Bentonville features Regus, Cast Coworkspace, and soon-to-open Ledger. NWA Workplaces has a location in Bentonville and Bella Vista. 

Click HERE for more info.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Support: A local community center is working on getting kids off the streets of Fayetteville. 
  • Contributions: Energy Arkansas is giving $1.8 million to help customers pay their bills amid high electricity demand. 
  • Ranked: The Tyson School of Innovation’s esports team is one of the top 10 best high school esports programs in the nation.
  • Plans: A new green space will replace an abandoned apartment complex in west Fayetteville. 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.
